summary.para: This component enables control over properties attached to AudioSource components for spatial sound in Unity.

Spatial sound on the HoloLens is enabled using an audio spatializer plugin. The plugin files are bundled directly into Unity so enabling spatial sound is as easy as going to Edit > Audio > Spatializer and enabling the Microsoft HRTF extension. Since Microsoft Spatial Sound only supports sampling rates of 48 kHz currently, you should also set your System Sample Rate to 48000 to prevent an HRTF failure in the rare case that your system output device is not set to 48000 already. Note that, while the Windows 10 SDK may be used to build HoloLens apps on Windows versions prior to Windows 10, if you aren't using Windows 10, you will not get Spatial Sound in the editor nor on the device. For more or potentially updated information, please see https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/holographic/spatial_sound_in_unity.
Describes room size to for audio effects.
Small, Medium, Large, and Outdoors are the four available size settings. According to Microsoft documentation, small is regarded as the "most average".
A designed for HoloLens input.
Derives from to translate tap and navigation gestures into emulated mouse input.
The base class for all spatial mapping components.

This class hosts several shared settings used by all spatial mapping components such as level of detail, surface observer volume, update frequency, etc. This class should never be used directly as a component.

member.name: T:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.LODType
member.summary: The number of triangles per cubic meter or level of detail that should be used when creating a surface mesh.

summary.para: The surface observer volume type to use when querying the system for changes in physical space.
The system can only return information about spatial surfaces within a surface volume.

member.name: T:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingCollider
member.summary: Creates and manages the GameObjects that represent spatial surfaces. A and will automatically be added to these game objects so that holograms can interact with physical surfaces.

member.name: T:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingRenderer
member.summary: Creates and manages the GameObjects that represent spatial surfaces. A , , and material will automatically be added to these GameObjects so that the spatial surface can be visualized.

member.name: T:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingRenderer.RenderState
member.summary: Specifies how to render the spatial surfaces associated with the SpatialMappingRenderer component instance.

summary.para: Describes room size to for audio effects.
Small, Medium, Large, and Outdoors are the four available size settings. According to Microsoft documentation, Small is regarded as the "most average"
See .
Called on all modules before process is sent to the one activated module.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.EventSystems.HoloLensInputModule.normalizedNavigationToScreenOffsetScalar
member.summary: Defines the number of pixels of emulated mouse movement when a value of positive or negative 1 is reported by the device for a navigation gesture.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.EventSystems.HoloLensInputModule.timeToPressOnTap
member.summary: Controls the number of seconds that taps (emulated mouse clicks) will leave any tapped UI object in the Pressed state for better user feedback.

summary.para: See .
Called when the module is activated.
See .
Check to see if the module is supported - must be running on HoloLens device and have targeted it in VR build settings.
See .
Overriden to add HoloLens-specific logic. Will only return true if HoloLens is supported and has been targeted in VR build settings.
Generates surface meshes with the maximum amount of triangles.
When using this setting, the best possible surface mesh, that conforms to the real world object, will be generated at the cost of memory and performance.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.LODType.Medium
member.summary: Generates a medium quality surface mesh.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.LODType.Low
member.summary: Generates surface meshes with as few triangles as possible.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.VolumeType.AxisAlignedBox
member.summary: An axis aligned bounding box volume.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingCollider.enableCollisions
member.summary: Enables/Disables components on all spatial surfaces associated with the SpatialMappingCollider component instance.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingCollider.layer
member.summary: Sets the layer on all spatial surfaces associated with the SpatialMappingCollider component instance.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingCollider.material
member.summary: Sets the on all spatial surfaces associated with the SpatialMappingCollider component instance.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.bakePhysics
member.summary: This property specifies whether or not collision data will be generated when computing the surface mesh's triangulation. (Read Only)

summary.para: Specifies if the component should listen and respond to spatial surface changes.
You can improve your performance by setting this property to false if you don't expect your physical environment to change significantly.
The half extents of the bounding box from its center.
This property is only used when the volume type is set to axis aligned bounding box.
The level of detail that should be used when generating surface meshes.
Level of detail corresponds to the number of triangles per cubic meter.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.numUpdatesBeforeRemoval
member.summary: The number of frames to keep a surface mesh alive for before destroying it after the system has determined that its real world counterpart has been removed.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingBase.secondsBetweenUpdates
member.summary: The time in seconds between system queries for changes in physical space.

summary.para: The radius of the bounding sphere volume.
This property is only used when the volume type is set to sphere.
The GameObject that should be the parent of all the component's surface mesh game objects.
When this property is set to null, a parent GameObject will be dynamically generated.
The surface observer volume to use when querying the system for changes in physical space.
The system can only return information about spatial surfaces within a surface volume.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingRenderer.RenderState.None
member.summary: Disables all components associated with the SpatialMappingRenderer component instance.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingRenderer.RenderState.Occlusion
member.summary: Indicates that the Occlusion material should be used to render the surfaces.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.WSA.SpatialMappingRenderer.RenderState.Visualization
member.summary: Indicates that the Visualization material should be used to render the surfaces.

summary.para: A Material applied to all surface meshes to enable occlusion of holograms by real world objects.
To apply the occlusion Material to all surface meshes, you must set the to Occlusion.
Controls which Material will be used when rendering a surface mesh.
When this property is changed, all spatial surfaces will be updated to use the correct Material.
A material that can be used to visualize the spatial surface.
To apply the visualization material to all surface meshes, you must set the to Visualization.
